original: BERGLUND, Karl Torkel, Bergsingenjör, Sandviken, f Gävle 24/3 96 av stadsvet Karl J B o Agda E Lindgren, gm Carola Bark. Studex 15, KTH 22, spec.stud 22—23. Ass v KTH i hyttmek o järnets bearb mm 24—26, stud.res på Jernkont stip i Tyskl, Schweiz, Frankr o Holl f stud av röntgenlab 25, på Sv-Amer stift o KTH stip t USA 26—27, 1. ass v KTH i metallogr o järnets bearb o be-handl 27—32, spec.lär v KTH 28—34, v Jernkont tekn forskn.verksamhet 28—33, forskn.-ing v Sandv jernverksAB 34, ch f metallurg f orskn.avd sed. 42. Av trycket: FI upps i Jernkontorets annaler.
translated: BERGLUND, Karl Torkel, Mining Engineer, Sandviken, b. Gävle 24/3 1896, son of the city engineer Karl J B and Agda E Lindgren, m. Carola Bark. Graduated 1915, Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) 1922, specialized studies 1922-1923. Assistant at KTH in blast furnace mechanics and iron processing et cetera 1924-1926, studying on a scholarship from Jernkontoret in Germany, Switzerland, France, and the Netherlands for X-ray lab studies in 1925, awarded scholarships from the Swedish-American Foundation and KTH to the USA 1926-1927. 1st assistant at KTH in metallography and iron processing and treatment 1927-1932, specialized lecturer at KTH 1928-1934, involved in technical research activities at Jernkontoret 1928-1933, research engineer at Sandviken Ironworks AB since 1934, appointed head of the metallurgy research department in 1942. Published in Jernkontoret's Annals.
